title: Advanced Psychiatry Quiz for Third-Year MD Students

questions.stem: Which of the following symptoms is primarily associated with a manic episode in bipolar disorder?
What is a key differentiating factor between delirium and dementia?
questions.correct_answer: Delirium has an acute onset whereas dementia has a gradual onset.
distractors: Dementia can be reversed, delirium cannot.
Delirium includes memory loss, dementia does not.
Both have rapid mental decline but are triggered differently.

questions.stem: In the context of psychosis, which neurotransmitter is most commonly associated with the neurobiological basis of psychotic symptoms?
When considering the management of major depressive disorder, which principle is considered essential?
questions.correct_answer: A multidisciplinary approach involving various mental health professionals

questions.stem: Which of the following is NOT typically considered a differential diagnosis when evaluating a patient for potential eating disorders?
In legal and ethical frameworks of mental health, what is primarily assessed within capacity assessments?
questions.correct_answer: The patient's ability to understand and make decisions regarding their care
distractors: The level of family support available

questions.stem: What is the primary focus when providing care for patients with end-stage dementia?
questions.correct_answer: Palliative care and support for the family

questions.stem: Which type of mental state examination would most likely include assessment of thought content and perception?
